intro: Crucihimalaya rupicola, commonly known as the Himalayan crucifix, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many well-known edible and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive cruciform flowers, which are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing remarkable adaptability to harsh mountain conditions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in alpine ecosystems.
